item.title: Pope Francis, in Nagasaki, Calls for Global Nuclear Disarmament
item.description: Pope Francis called on nations with nuclear bombs to abandon them, even for deterrence, and warned of a new arms race from an erosion of multilateral agreements controlling weapons of mass destruction.

item.title: Protests in Colombia Stretch Into Third Day
item.description: Marchers accused security forces of brutality and government officials claimed that an outbreak of looting and vandalism was part of an orchestrated terror campaign.

item.title: Bolivia Legislators Rush to Approve New Election Without Morales
item.description: Lawmakers rushed Saturday to approve legislation that paves the way for a new presidential election and bars the candidacy of Evo Morales, marking a new path for his socialist movement without its standard-bearer.

item.title: Merkel's Coalition Government Faces Test Over Huawei Dispute
item.description: Chancellor Angela Merkel was handed a damaging defeat at her party’s annual convention over her plans to allow China’s Huawei to build Germany’s next-generation 5G mobile network.

item.title: At a Migrant Camp in Mexico, the Crowds and Complaints Swell
item.description: At a tent camp at the border in Matamoros, one of Mexico’s most dangerous cities, several thousand migrants await asylum hearings in the U.S. Some say they qualify to enter the U.S. immediately but have been rejected.

item.title: Global Wave of Protests Rattles Governments
item.description: It started in Hong Kong in June, when hundreds of thousands of young demonstrators connected by messaging apps took to the streets. Four months on, antigovernment demonstrations have swept more than a dozen countries.

item.title: Millions of Hong Kongers to Take to the Streets Again---This Time to Vote
item.description: Voters head to the polls Sunday for scheduled district elections that may offer residents a political outlet to vent frustrations after months of violent clashes between protesters and police.

item.title: Trump Calls Hong Kong Protests 'Complicating Factor' in Trade Talks
item.description: President Trump called antigovernment protests in Hong Kong a “complicating factor” in his bid for a trade deal with China and didn’t say whether he would sign a bill passed by Congress supporting the protesters.
